title: Bodycam & 911 Records for Dec 2, 2024 Hostage Arrest (Bear Creek Dr.)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All body-worn camera and in-car video from Fort Collins Police officers during the Dec 2, 2024 incident on/near the 700 block of Bear Creek Dr., where SWAT arrested a male suspect who allegedly held a woman hostage.

Also any associated 911 recordings, CAD call logs, and radio/dispatch audio related to this incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Wilkinson

title: Bodycam & 911 Records for Oct 25, 2024 Freezer Body Discovery (Joseph Hill Jr.)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All body-worn camera and in-car camera footage from Tempe Police officers responding on Oct 25, 2024 , where Joseph Daniel Hill Jr. was arrested for concealment of a body and failure to report a death.

Also any associated 911 call recordings, CAD call logs, and radio/dispatch audio related to this incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Daniel Wilkinson

title: Biannual or annual postmarket safety reports on lecanemab

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Biannual or annual postmarket safety reports on lecanemab
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

September 11, 2025
Food and Drug Administration
Division of Freedom of Information (HFI-35)

RE: Freedom of Information Act request

Dear FOIA Officer:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a, I am requesting copies of the post-market biannual  and/or annual safety reports that the FDA has required Eisai (Biogen as cooperating company) to submit to include data on ARIA,, brain hemorrhages and death s related to lecanemab/Leqembi (application 761269Orig1s000).  The reports are required according to FDAAA Section 505(o)(3) and the first report would have been due in or around June 2023 and then annually in June 2024 and June 2025 (or thereabouts).  However, it appears the reports might not have been submitted to the FDA as the PMR site at FDA states its status is "Delayed" and that "The final protocol submission was missed and the FDA issued a missed milestone letter on 04/21/2025, and a subsequent failure to respond letter on 06/17/2025."  

Since the above-mentioned reports are required, they should be easy to  immediately identify electronically as PMR 4497-1 and to forward to us. If instead, the company has not submitted any reports, or omitted some reports, we request confirmation of that.  We first requested these reports in November 2024. We believe the mortality data is critical for the public health and safety and hope the FDA will assist with obtaining their immediate release.

I am a professional journalist writing with my colleague, Shannon Brownlee, for The BMJ and The Lever.
 
As an investigative journalist, I request a waiver of fees associated with processing this FOIA request and duplicating responsive records.  

Thank you for your attention to this request.

Sincerely,


Jeanne Lenzer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeanne Lenzer
